alert.note: Alert for Central La Paz; Kofa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 11:40AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central La Paz and north central Yuma Counties through 1230 PM MST... At 1138 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms south of Brenda in the Kofa Mountains, or 40 miles northeast of Martinez Lake. These storma were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kofa Wildlife Refuge, Brenda and Palm Canyon. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 25 and 47. US Highway 60 between mile markers 31 and 40. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 83 and 85. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
